hints.content:
$\purpleD{64} = {\greenD{?}}-\goldE{283}$

![A number line with 2 points labeled. An arrow from point question mark back to point 64 is labeled, minus 283.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/c6f887cf55066ce8f67d021fa2581d1b23b0df19)

What number can we subtract $\goldE{283}$ from and be left with $\purpleD{64}?$

We can add $\goldE{283}$ to $\purpleD{64}$ to find the missing number.

$\begin{align}\goldE{283}&\\
\underline{+ \purpleD{64}} &\\
\greenD{347}&\end{align}$

![The same number line as above, with the question mark replaced with 347 and an arrow from 64 to 347 labeled plus 283](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/2722477ca8a938525a34f161db1027e831af7f9d)

question.content:
**What number makes this equation true?**

$64 = {}$ [[â˜ƒ numeric-input 1]] ${} - 283$
